at a demolition site, bricks slide down a straight chute into a container. the chute is rough 
and is inclined at an angle of 30 to the horizontal. the distance travelled down the chute by 
each brick is 8 m. a brick of mass 3 kg is released from rest at the top of the chute. when it 
reaches the bottom of the chute, its speed is 5 m s–1. 
 
 
(a) find the potential energy lost by the brick in moving down the chute.  
(2) 
 
(b) by using the work-energy principle, or otherwise, find the constant frictional force acting 
on the brick as it moves down the chute. 
(5) 
 
(c) hence find the coefficient of friction between the brick and the chute. 
(3) 
 
 
another brick of mass 3 kg slides down the chute. this brick is given an initial speed of
